msIdentifier.institution: Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland

msItem.title: The Arabic sentences which occur in the Gulistan, with Persian translations.
msItem.note: First flyleaf, verso: Presented by Dr Conwell June 29. 1830 Second flyleaf, recto: William Eugene Cowell. 1811. Bellary The Arabic is written in naskh in black ink, the Persian in nasta'liq in red. Has no title or introduction. The identification of the subject is given by Morley.

handNote.desc: Naskh and nasta'liq with some shikastah forms.

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather binding with blind tooling, probably Indian but with European-style sewing.

acquisition.p: Presented by Dr William Eugene Conwell.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
